text: Tradition says that in a distant country there existed a few years ago a Owl who by the force of meditating and burning the lashes studying, thinking, translating, giving lectures, writing poems, stories, biographies, film chronicles, speeches, literary essays and some other things, came to know and to treat it practically everything in any genre of human knowledge, in such a notorious way that his contemporary enthusiasts soon declared him one of the Seven Sages of the Country, without until now being able to find out who the other six were. The Black Sheep and Other Fables
title: Los otros seis
author: Augusto Monterroso
